sentences.english: The fear is that the next election, due next year, will follow the same course.
sentences.chinese: 恐怕明年的下一輪選舉也難逃相同的厄運。

sentences.english: Having boomed for so long, Florida's economy is now ailing.
sentences.chinese: 佛羅里達州經濟長盛不衰，如今卻也難逃厄運。

sentences.english: This is further evidence that we are well on the way to the next great extinction event.
sentences.chinese: 這也進一步證明我們正在走向下一次大滅絕的厄運。

sentences.english: "Unlucky people collapse under bad luck, " says Dr. Wiseman.
sentences.chinese: 懷斯曼醫生說，“厄運來時，倒黴的人會崩潰。

sentences.english: Maybe they can finally end their frustrating jinx in Detroit.
sentences.chinese: 也許他們終於可以結束在底特律的厄運。

sentences.english: As a result, misfortune befell. Liu Hongyu fouled out, too.
sentences.chinese: 結果厄運降臨，劉宏宇也被罰掉。

sentences.english: A cleft lip or palate is not a curse or omen.
sentences.chinese: 脣裂或齶裂並非上天的詛咒，厄運的徵兆。

sentences.english: He used to be rich, but he met with reverses in his business.
sentences.chinese: 他過去很富有，但後來在生意上連遭厄運。

sentences.english: The boggart is a malicious fairy who causes personal calamities, small and large.
sentences.chinese: 幻形怪是一種能給人們帶來各種厄運的邪惡精靈。

sentences.english: Death from illness is ideal, whereas accidental death and suicide carry stigmas or bad luck.
sentences.chinese: 病死是理想的，反之意外死亡和自殺帶來恥辱和厄運。

sentences.english: With the yellow face of Doom.
sentences.chinese: 蠟黃的臉色預示厄運就要降臨。

sentences.english: One many counteract the effect of spilled salt, or bad luck, by throwing a little over the left shoulder.
sentences.chinese: 越過左肩撒落一些鹽可消除撒鹽帶來的影響或者厄運。

sentences.english: Nine beads is evil, and people can turn bad luck to good luck.
sentences.chinese: 九眼天珠是驅邪的，能爲人轉厄運爲吉祥。

sentences.english: Chen Jiata had never imagined that his family would be doomed to suffer this strange disease.
sentences.chinese: 陳佳塔沒有想到厄運就這樣降臨在自己家裏。

sentences.english: Don't shed crocodile tears over his misfortune，I know you hate him.
sentences.chinese: 不要假惺惺的爲他的厄運假慈悲了，我知道你恨他。

sentences.english: One of a series of waves or wavelike segments.
sentences.chinese: 這一家遭到一連串的厄運。

definition: different routes to the same destination (idiom); fig. different means of achieve the same end
lit. to have one's hands bound and be unable to do anything about it (idiom); fig. helpless in the face of a crisis
to make progress only with great difficulty (idiom)
not knowing which course to follow (idiom); at a loss what to do
to leave a place where some event is taking place/(of an actor) to exit/(sports) to leave the field/(of an audience) to leave
to escape (danger)/to rescue/to come out alive
